title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is cited as the short title. The authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture is transferred to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of Agriculture is required to conduct a census of agriculture every five years, starting in 1998. The data collected in each census relates to the previous year. Failure to answer census questions truthfully may result in penalties under the United States Code. The census under this subsection includes each State, the District of Columbia, and other areas under US jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information collected under title 13 to the Secretary of Agriculture for census purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide information for census purposes under title 13, United States Code, upon request from the Secretary of Commerce. Rules and regulations for this subsection can be prescribed by the respective Secretaries. Effective October 1, 1998, certain sections of the United States Code and the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act were amended or repealed. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. (a) Information Furnished to the Department of Agriculture and Department of Commerce is amended to include specific sections of the Revised Statutes for authority and confidentiality of information. The curr_chunk states that information provided under section 526(c)(6) of the Revised Statutes is treated as if it were furnished under title 13 of the United States Code. The House of Representatives passed the document on July 22, 1996, with Robin H. Carle as the Clerk.
